text:
When you think about who can produce 3D
content today
it's really limited

to people who are very technically skilled
and have spent years training.

My sister and I founded Krikey
about seven years ago.

Krikey’s mission is to empower
anyone to animate a talking 3D character.

We started to think,
what if there was a way

where we could make
the animation process faster,

and that's how we came up with the idea
for text to animation
and video to animation

so that anyone can
not only generate animations,

but also turn them into high quality
3D content.

We saw that 
AWS had a Generative AI Accelerator,

we were really excited to just apply
and throw our hat in the ring.

We've been a part of six different startup
accelerators, and AWS

has by far been the best in terms
of their actual commitment and dedication
to ensuring startup success.
I think as a small team to receive that type

of support and knowledge transfer
and training has been invaluable for us.
We were assigned a mentor at AWS.

They were able to connect us with Canva,
they were starting to look for partners

in AI, who could integrate with them
as part of their new app.

The day that we launched on Canva,
our traffic actually went up by 23x,

and that would never have happened
had we not been on the Generative
AI Accelerator.
Once we started working with AWS,

we realized there was a huge opportunity
in the enterprise space.
While building our enterprise solution,

AWS worked very closely
with us in developing the product

feature set that would be most valuable
to enterprise customers.
We needed to train our foundation model,

which would require
quite a lot of compute,

and we were able to use the credits from
AWS Activate, towards all of our training costs,

and this actually enabled us
to hire a QA team,

which has helped us
grow our subscriber base
and improve the quality of our product.

Having AWS’s guidance
as we go to market,

selling our enterprise product
and our consumer product

has really enabled us to grow much faster
than we would have on our own.

As a female founded startup, often
when we go to pitch
we aren't taking as seriously.

And so having an Amazon
representative in the room with us

while we make our sales
pitch has made a tremendous difference

in the way that our product
and we are received in the room.

That level of mentorship
we've never had anywhere else before.
Animation hasn't been disrupted in decades,

And we are on the edge of a revolution
where artists, animators, creators

and game developers can plug generative
AI into their existing creative workflows

and accelerate time to market
by producing animated content faster.
There's so many people

who have valid stories to tell,
but they may not have the resources

or the time to learn the skills necessary
to tell the stories in the way they want.
And we're really excited to empower

diverse storytellers with our tool
so that anyone can tell

a story, regardless of their background,
or where they come from.
